newsitem.title: USA: NorAm holders approve Houston merger.
newsitem.headline: NorAm holders approve Houston merger.

text.p: NorAm Energy Corp said Tuesday its shareholders approved the company's proposed merger into Houston Industries Inc.
Over 78 percent of the 137.2 million outstanding common shares represented at the meeting, and 99 percent were voted in favor of the merger, NorAm said.

Under the terms of the agreement announced on August 12, Houston Industries will pay about $16.00 for each NorAm common share outstanding. About 50 percent will be paid in cash and 50 percent in Houston Industries common stock.
The transaction is valued at $3.9 billion, including $2.5 billion for NorAm common stock and $1.4 billion of NorAm debt.
The combined entity will have a total market capitalization of some $14.3 billion.
The merger is subject to the completion of regulatory clearances and is expected to close during the first quarter of 1997, NorAm said. ((-- Jim Brumm 212-859-1710.))
